description: The move comes after more conciliatory tones from Moscow, which has also urged a dialogue between the Ukraine government and separatists.
title: German Official Lands in Kiev to Broker Talks Between Govt, Separatists
title_page: German Official Lands in Kiev to Broker Talks Between Govt, Separatists
text:
Breaking News Emails Get breaking news alerts and special reports. The news and stories that matter, delivered weekday mornings.
Germany’s foreign minister traveled to Ukraine on Tuesday in a bid to broker a dialogue between the government and separatists and resolve the fallout from a controversial referendum that could see the east of the country joining Russia.
Pro-Russian separatists who called and oversaw the poll said an overwhelming majority voted in favor of splitting from Kiev and coming under Moscow’s rule.
The United States, Europe, and Ukraine’s central government have all denounced the vote as illegal.
With a response pending from the Kremlin to the so-called Donetsk People’s Republic formal request for annexation by Russia, Germany's Foreign Minister Frank-Walter Steinmeier met with Ukraine’s interim Prime Minister Arseniy Yatsenyuk and Foreign Minister Andrii Deshchytsia.
